statements.name: PROC TTEST
statements.description: The TTEST procedure performs t tests and computes confidence limits for one sample, paired observations, two independent samples, and the AB/BA crossover design.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies that confidence intervals (except test-based mean confidence intervals when the TOST option is used) are to be 100(1 - α)% confidence intervals, where 0 < α < 1.

arguments.name: BYVAR
arguments.description: Groups the results by the PAIRED or VAR variables.

arguments.name: CI=
arguments.description: Specifies whether a confidence interval is displayed for σ and, if so, what kind.

arguments.name: EQUAL
arguments.description: Specifies an equal-tailed confidence interval, and it is the default.

arguments.name: UMPU
arguments.description: Specifies an interval based on the uniformly most powerful unbiased test of Ho: σ=σ0.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Requests that no confidence interval be displayed for σ.

arguments.name: COCHRAN
arguments.description: Requests the Cochran and Cox approximation of the probability level for the unequal variances situation.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the SAS data set for the procedure to use.

arguments.name: DIST=
arguments.description: Specifies the underlying distribution assumed for the data.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Lognormal distribution

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Normal distribution

arguments.name: H0=
arguments.description: Requests tests against a null value of m, unless the TOST option is used, in which case m is merely used to derive the lower and upper equivalence bounds.

arguments.name: NOBYVAR
arguments.description: Includes all PAIRED or VAR variables together in each output table.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sorting order for the levels of the classification variable (specified in the CLASS statement) and treatment variables (specified in the CROSSOVER option in the VAR statement).

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order depends on your operating environment.

arguments.name: MIXED
arguments.description: Same as ORDER=FORMATTED if the unformatted variable is character-valued; same as ORDER=INTERNAL otherwise (unformatted variable is numeric-valued)

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Syntax: PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> <= plot-request <(options)>> PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> <= (plot-request <(options)> <... plot-request <(options)>>)> Controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics. ONLY suppresses the default plots SHOWH0 shows the null value (as specified by the H0= option in the PROC TTEST statement) in all relevant plots.
arguments.help: PLOTS=ALL | AGREEMENT | BOX | HISTOGRAM | INTERVAL | NONE | PROFILES | QQ | SUMMARY

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all appropriate plots.

arguments.name: AGREEMENT
arguments.description: Requests an agreement plot.

arguments.name: BOX
arguments.description: Requests a box plot or comparative box plots.

arguments.name: HISTOGRAM
arguments.description: Requests a histogram or comparative histograms with overlaid normal and kernel densities.

arguments.name: INTERVAL
arguments.description: Requests plots of confidence interval for means.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: PROFILES
arguments.description: Requests a profiles plot.

arguments.name: QQ
arguments.description: Requests a normal quantile-quantile (Q-Q) plot.

arguments.name: SUMMARY
arguments.description: Requests HISTOGRAM and BOX plots together in a single panel, sharing common X axes.

arguments.name: SIDES=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of sides (or tails) and direction of the statistical tests and test-based confidence intervals.
(The default) specifies two-sided tests and confidence intervals for means.

arguments.name: L
arguments.description: Specifies lower one-sided tests, in which the alternative hypothesis indicates a mean less than the null value, and lower one-sided confidence intervals between minus infinity and the upper confidence limit.

arguments.name: U
arguments.description: Specifies upper one-sided tests, in which the alternative hypothesis indicates a mean greater than the null value, and upper one-sided confidence intervals between the lower confidence limit and infinity.

arguments.name: TEST=
arguments.description: Specifies the test criterion.

arguments.name: DIFF
arguments.description: Used to test the difference of means.

arguments.name: RATIO
arguments.description: Used to test the ratio of means.

arguments.name: TOST
arguments.description: Requests Schuirman’s TOST equivalence test. The upper equivalence bound must be specified. If TEST=DIFF, then the default value for the lower equivalence bound is 2m-upper, where m is the value of the H0= option. If TEST=RATIO, then the default value for lower is m/upper.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: A CLASS statement giving the name of the classification (or grouping) variable must accompany the PROC TTEST statement in the two-independent-sample case.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The variable in the FREQ statement identifies a variable that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation. PROC TTEST treats each observation as if it appears n times, where n is the value of the FREQ variable for the observation.

statements.name: PAIRED
statements.description: The PairLists in the PAIRED statement identifies the variables to be compared in paired comparisons. You can use one or more PairLists.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement names the variables to be used in the analyses. One-sample comparisons are conducted when the VAR statement is used without the CROSSOVER option or CLASS statement. Two-independent-sample comparisons are conducted when the VAR statement is used with a CLASS statement.

arguments.name: CROSSOVER=
arguments.description: Specifies the variables representing the treatment applied in each of the two periods in an AB/BA crossover design.

arguments.name: IGNOREPERIOD
arguments.description: Indicates that the period effect shall be ignored—that is, assumed to be equal to 0 (if TEST=DIFF) or 1 (if TEST=RATIO).

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: The WEIGHT statement weights each observation in the input data set by the value of the WEIGHT variable. The values of the WEIGHT variable can be nonintegral, and they are not truncated.
